result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandel M Brown-Stanton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: AS TO COUNTS 1 & 2: Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs. Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges by 08-24-15 or, if not paid, a civil judgment is ordered.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Signed Earned Release Program/Substance Abuse Program Order mailed to Department of Correction Attn. Records 2909 E Park Ave. Chippewa Falls Wi 54729

- signed and filed.  
IT IS ORDERED that the department of corrections will effectuate the change from confinement to extended supervision upon receipt of this order, determining the actual number of days served in confinement and changing the remaining confinement to extended supervision.  the number of days that are converted from confinement time toe extended supervision will be determined by a DOC records office staff member and will be based upon actual release date. 
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the warden/superintendent of the institution to which the prisoner is assigned shall effect his or her release upon receipt of this order.

records.addlTxt: Bail Refund Check Packet
8/20/15 bail refund notice/affidavit mailed to surety.
Original PLEA & SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (39 pages) commencing JUNE 25, 2015 received and filed.
Cash bail applied.

Defendant Brandel M Brown-Stanton in court with attorney David Knute Ziemer.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
AS TO COUNT 1: On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to Possession of THC, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 961.41(3g)(e), a Misd.
AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank.
AS TO COUNT 2: Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.

AS TO COUNT 1: Court ordered the defendant to serve 6 months concurrent in the HOC. 
AS TO COUNT 2: The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 4 YEARS CONCURRENT, with credit for 184 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.  The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program".
AS TO BOTH COUNTS: Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs by 8.24.15. Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges by 8.24.15 or, if not paid, a civil judgment is ordered.
AS TO COUNT 2: Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. 
Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;

Certification of MOTION HEARING transcript commencing MAY 28, 2015, received and filed. (35 Pages)  Copy of transcript forwarded to:  DAVID ZIEMER, 6920 N. ARDARA AVE., GLENDALE, WI  53209.

Defendant Brandel M Brown-Stanton in court with attorney David Knute Ziemer.  Defendant Brandel M Brown-Stanton in custody.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sworn for the State: MPD Officer Matthew Vandrisse. Case adjourned for a decision.  Decision scheduled for 08-03-2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney David Knute Ziemer in court, defendant Brandel M Brown-Stanton not in court, in custody.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court is in trial.  Court ordered case adjourned for motion hearing in Branch 7.  Motion hearing scheduled for 05-28-2015 at 01:30 pm.
Filed, Defendant's Motion to Supress

Attorney David Knute Ziemer in court, defendant Brandel M Brown-Stanton not in court, in custody.  Hanna Kolberg for Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel waived reading of the Complaint and entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of defendant.  Motion hearing scheduled for 05-11-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brandel M Brown-Stanton in court with attorney David Knute Ziemer.  Defendant Brandel M Brown-Stanton in custody.  Nathaniel Adamson for Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
NO DA FILE IN COURT.
 Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Thomas McAdams, Branch 07.  Arraignment scheduled for March 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brandel M Brown-Stanton in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Brandel M Brown-Stanton in custody.  Hanna Kolberg for Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense Counsel informs the Court that the defendant is requesting another attorney to represent him.  Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Bridget Kruase for Alexis Liggins in court, defendant Brandel M Brown-Stanton not in court, in custody.  Randy Sitzberger for Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant was not produced from the House of Correction.  State did have a witness present for today's proceedings.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 25, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Brandel M Brown-Stanton in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Defendant Brandel M Brown-Stanton in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge McAdams, Branch 7.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
